data.title: Australians petition to put Steve Irwin on their money.
The death of a young Chinese actress from cancer has sparked a debate on social media - because she initially chose traditional Chinese medicine over chemotherapy.
Egyptian state media claims 9/11 was carried out by West to justify war on terror

A former Filipino militiaman testified before the country's Senate on Thursday that President Rodrigo Duterte, when he was still a city mayor, ordered him and other members of a liquidation squad to kill criminals and opponents in gangland-style assaults that left about 1,000 dead
Mexico wants to build a border wall with Central America to keep out illegal immigrants
WikiLeaks' Julian Assange offers to surrender if Chelsea Manning is released

Britain’s failure to protect girls from female genital mutilation (FGM) has been described as a “national scandal” by a committee of MPs, who said it was “beyond belief” that, 30 years since it became illegal, not a single person has been convicted of the crime.
Germans back mandatory education for refugees: Three-quarters of Germans support language classes for refugees paid for by the state.

In a study that shatters a cornerstone concept in linguistics, an analysis of nearly two-thirds of the world’s languages shows that humans tend to use the same sounds for common objects and ideas, no matter what language they’re speaking.
U.S. confirms two more freed Guantanamo inmates rejoined militant groups

Fentanyl is so dangerous that some cops now carry an antidote in case they touch it - Touching or inhaling even a small amount of fentanyl can be fatal, so federal police in Canada are now carrying naloxone in case they come in contact with it.
Scientists reveal most accurate depiction of a dinosaur ever created

Humanity driving 'unprecedented' marine extinction: Report comparing past mass extinction events warns that hunting and killing of ocean’s largest species will disrupt ecosystems for millions of years
St John's Wort 'stops emergency contraceptive pill working.'
'My shift has finished': Spanish train driver abandons 109 passengers in the countryside
